listing.description: A spacious four bedroom townhouse located between Bromley, Hayes and West Wickham town centres, offered for sale with no onward chain. The property is arranged in a split level design and comprises of an entrance porch which leads to a downstairs shower room, entrance hall and a flexible ground floor bedroom which was formally an integral garage. Stairs lead up to the dining room with doors leading to the rear garden and a modern kitchen with several integrated appliances. There is full width lounge with further stairs leading up to a modern refitted bathroom and bedroom one which has two fitted wardrobes. The top floor has bedrooms two and three, each again having fitted wardrobes. Outside there is a bright and sunny rear garden and off street parking for several vehicles. The property features double glazing and gas central heating via radiators. This enviable location is ideal for local shops at Westmorland Road, Hayes with its popular high street and West Wickham's High street which features a number of popular stores including Marks and Spencer and Sainsbury's. There are a number of popular restaurants to be found locally including the former Pickhurst Pub, now a Miller and Carter Steak restaurant a short walk from the property. Cupola Wood/Park offers an ideal peaceful area to relax in. listing.short_description:
Exceptionally spacious ground floor two bedroom apartment with sun terrace is offered 'chain free' and with a Share of the Freehold. The property is ideally located for central Bromley and its shopping, travel and leisure facilities. Situated on the ground floor and looking over the communal grounds, the property comprises of two double bedrooms, family bathroom, shower room, large kitchen/breakfast room, 20'2 x 16'8 lounge and large South facing sun terrace. Other benefits include en bloc garage to rear and ample parking to front. This spacious apartment needs some modernisation and we recommend an early viewing to avoid disappointment.

Communal Entrance

Secure video entry phone operated front door leads into communal entrance with lift and stairs to all floors.

Entrance Hall

Hardwood front door leads into entrance hall. Radiator, video entry phone handset and telephone point.

Kitchen/Breakfast Room (21'9 x 9' (6.63m x 2.74m))

High level double glazed windows to front and side. Two radiators and tiled flooring to kitchen area, range of wall and base units with work surfaces over, stainless steel double sink with mixer tap, integrated four ring gas hob and Zanussi double oven. Space for fridge freezer, space and plumbing for washing machine and dishwasher.

Lounge (20'02 x 16'8 (6.15m x 5.08m))

Double glazed panoramic picture window to front with sliding doors leading to South facing sun terrace. Coving, two radiators, telephone and TV aerial points.

Sun Terrace (16'8 x 7'5 (5.08m x 2.26m))

South facing sun terrace with personal gate to side, outside light and tiled floor.

Family Bathroom (9'5 x 8'10 (max) (2.87m x 2.69m ( max)))

Panel bath with shower mixer tap, fully tiled walls, extractor fan and white ladder towel warmer. Wash hand basin with mixer tap set in vanity unit providing storage below. Mirror and light over with electric shaver point and concealed cistern low level WC.

Airing/Linen Cupboard (5'10 x 3' (1.78m x 0.91m))

Large airing/linen cupboard with immersion heater and water tank.

Shower Room (5'10 x 5'9 (1.78m x 1.75m))

Pedestal wash hand basin with vanity unit below providing storage, mirror, glass shelf and light with electric shaver point above. Low level WC, corner shower cubicle with wall mounted controls, fully tiled walls and radiator. Wall mounted mirrored medicine cabinet and extractor fan.

Bedroom One (16'8 x 10'6 (max) (5.08m x 3.20m ( max)))

High level double glazed window to side, radiator and two sets of fitted triple wardrobes.

Bedroom Two (15'1 x 9'1 (4.60m x 2.77m))

High level double glazed window to side, radiator and cupboard housing boiler. Fitted double wardrobes with vanity area and mirror with overhead storage.

Communal Grounds, Parking & Garage

Permit parking to front and garage en-bloc to rear of building with up & over door. Well maintained mature communal grounds surround the properties, garages and parking.

Lease & Charges

The property comes with a Share of the Freehold. We have been informed that the service charges are approximately £2,000 per annum.

Directions

From our office at the top of Westmoreland Road proceed towards Bromley South and Florida Court can be found on the left hand side between South Hill Road and Cumberland Road. Flat 19 is in the central block on the ground floor.

listing.description: A three story, three bedroom townhouse offering flexible accommodation located between Bromley and the sought after village of Locksbottom. The accommodation comprises of an entrance hall with useful downstairs cloakroom leading to a spacious rear lounge overlooking the low maintenance rear garden. The ground floor also has a 16'6 integral garage which could be converted to further living accommodation, subject to consent. The first floor has a large, modern fitted kitchen/dining room, a spacious landing area and the third bedroom, having two fitted wardrobes. The top floor has two double bedrooms, bedroom one having inbuilt wardrobes and a refitted bathroom/WC. Outside there is a low maintenance rear garden and off street parking to the front. The property features double glazing and gas central heating via radiators. There are local buses a short distance away connecting you to Bromley Town centre, providing an array of shopping, entertainment and commercial facilities along with excellent transport links to London. Locksbottom has an array of popular restaurants, coffee shops and supermarkets including a Sainsbury's superstore. Orpington is also a short distance away providing further shopping facilities and a number of high quality schools for all ages including Darrick wood. listing.description: Water’s edge, keston ponds - luxury apartments by millgate launching Saturday 4th & Sunday 5th March 2017A collection of 13 one and two bedroom luxury apartments set within two beautifully restored buildings.Water’s Edge comprises thirteen luxurious and perfectly proportioned apartments nestled in the Keston countryside within easy reach of transport links. Two striking buildings, Forest Lodge, an imposing 19th manor house, and Alder House, a grand red brick building, have been fastidiously converted by award winning developers Millgate to create this collection of highly specified apartments all enjoying use of the beautiful, landscaped grounds and woodland surroundings. Each apartment is unique in its design and layout yet all offer spacious, well-proportioned rooms, highly specified, fully integrated kitchens, generous receptions, bedrooms with a range of fitted wardrobes, and luxurious bathrooms. Some apartments further benefit from a private terrace or patio, whilst off-street parking is provided to each apartment.Specification highlights include:• Hand painted Shaker style kitchens with soft close cabinets, stone worktops, wine coolers and integrated Siemens appliances• Utility cupboard with stacked Siemens washing machine & condenser tumble dryer• Ceramic & porcelain tiled bathrooms and en suites with stone worktops, Villeroy & Boch sanitaryware, full width mirrors and underfloor heating• Wood flooring to living areas and luxury carpet to all bedrooms• Bespoke cabinetry and wardrobes to all bedrooms• Colour video entry door system• Off-street parking and secure cycle storeLocationWater’s Edge, in the heart of Keston’s beautiful countryside, is perfectly located to enjoy the tranquillity of the parks, lakes and commons yet just a short walk to the local shops and amenities. Embrace village life at Keston’s two highly regarded pubs, The Fox and The Greyhound, or enjoy exquisite fine dining at critically acclaimed Chapter One, less than a mile away. Neighbouring Locksbottom Village provides a large range of shopping facilities including a Sainsbury’s superstore along with a good selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Central London is easily accessible by rail with direct trains to Victoria from Bromley South; a direct stopping service to Charing Cross, St. Pancras International and Victoria from Orpington Station; and a service to London Bridge, Waterloo East & Charing Cross from Hayes Station, located just 1.9 miles from Water’s Edge.The local school, Keston CoE Primary, has been rated ‘Outstanding’ by Ofsted, as have both nearby Grammar Schools, Newstead Woods & St. Olave’s.First phase pricing from £395,000 - £750,000please contact us to book your appointment for the launch event.All images are computer generated or of previous Millgate schemes.Leasehold

listing.description: A two bedroom semi detached house set within a quiet Mews development in a sought after location close to Bromley Common. The property is ideally located for local shops on Southborough Lane and library, in addition to the wide range of shops, cafes and restaurants in the well regarded Chatterton Village.Situated to the rear of this small development the property benefits from two parking spaces to the front of the property in addition to provision for visitor parking. This is an ideal property with the potential to add value as it offers the scope to extend to the side (stpp). Internally there is a good sized living/dining room with French doors opening onto the garden and a separate kitchen fitted with a full range of wall and base units, an integrated oven and hob and space for a freestanding fridge/freezer and washing machine.Upstairs the master bedroom is fitted with a range of built in wardrobes and the second double bedroom also benefits from a built in storage cupboard. A shower/wet room completes the upstairs accommodation which is all accessed from a spacious landing. To the rear of the property is a large Westerly facing garden which measures 62'3 deep from the back of the house and benefits from an additional side patio area measuring 22'5 x 9'7 which leads to a shed and the side access gate.Although Freehold there is a service charge (currently £150 pa) for maintenance of the communal areas. Ownership of the property includes a 1/10th share in the management company. The property is offered End of Chain.

The property is offered Share of Freehold and with No Onward Chain.

listing.short_description:
Rarely available and spacious two bedroom ground floor maisonette (765 sqft) with a long lease (over 900 years), private garden, detached garage and driveway located in a quiet residential cul de sac in central Hayes. Just a short was to local shops & Hayes station the property comprises two double bedrooms, large lounge, shower room and fitted kitchen. To the rear is a 25' x 25' (approx) rear garden which is currently paved with a shingle border and detached garage to side with private driveway. The property is currently tenanted on an ast, so is ideal for a buy to let investor.

Entrance Hall

Double glazed door to side. Range of built in storage cupboards to one wall with two further storage cupboards. Wall mounted secure video entry phone handset and radiator.

Lounge (17'2 x 11'1 (5.23m x 3.38m))

Double glazed windows and door to rear. Coving, wall lights, radiator, serving hatch to kitchen and Virgin TV point.

Fitted Kitchen (12'8 x 7'9 (3.86m x 2.36m))

Double glazed window to rear and door to side. Range of fitted wall and base units with work surfaces over, local tiling and stainless steel sink with mixer tap and drainer. Space for electric cooker with wall mounted extractor fan over, space and plumbing for washing machine and dish washer, space for fridge freezer, wood effect flooring, radiator and built in cupboard housing wall mounted Worcester combination boiler.

Shower Room

Opaque double glazed window to side. Double shower cubicle with wall mounted thermostatic controls, low level W.C, pedestal wash hand basin with mono bloc mixer tap and mirror above, wood effect flooring, fully tiled walls and white wall mounted ladder towel warmer.

Bedroom One (12'4 x 11'1 (3.76m x 3.38m))

Double glazed window to front, coving and radiator.

Bedroom Two (15' x 9'8 (4.57m x 2.95m))

Double glazed window to front, coving and radiator.

Rear Garden (25' x 25' (approx) (7.62m x 7.62m ( appro x )))

Low maintenance paved garden with shingle boarders and access gate to rear leading to Hayes station and High Street.

Garage

Detached garage with up and over door to front, door and window to side, power and light.

Front Garden

Mainly paved with mature shrubs and private path to side leading to front door, garage and rear garden

Lease & Charges

We have been informed that the property comes with a lease in excess of 900 years, a peppercorn rent basis and the service charge is approximately £350 per Annum.

Directions

From Hayes Train Station turn right and at the mini roundabout proceed down Bourne Way. Take the first turning on the left into Holland Way then take the first turning on your left into Holland Close. The property is on the left hand side.

listing.description: An attractive north-facing two -bedroom apartment on the second floor of the over 55s development with a balcony and private allocated car parking space. The property has been recently refurbished, the kitchen is bright and spacious with ample storage and the airy lounge has the benefit of the balcony overlooking the front gardens. It is close to Shortlands National Rail Service, which provides 25-minute access to Central London. listing.short_description:
Versatile 'Chain Free' Chelsea style two double bedroom split-level flat on the ground and first floors. The property, which is to be sold with an extended lease, is located in the very popular Fair Acres development which is within easy reach of Bromley Town centre and all of the amenities it has to offer. The accommodation to the ground floor offers a double bedroom with built-in wardrobes and door to communal gardens, shower room and storage cupboard. The first floor offers a large lounge with panoramic picture window overlooking the communal grounds, fitted kitchen with appliances and second double bedroom. Additional benefits include integral garage, driveway providing off street parking, double glazing, newly decorated exterior and serviced boiler.

Entrance Hall (15'6 x 6'3 (4.72m x 1.91m))

Double glazed door and opaque double glazed window to front. Radiator, large storage cupboard and parquet flooring.

Bedroom Two (13' x 9'7 (3.96m x 2.92m))

Double glazed window and door to rear overlooking the communal grounds. Radiator, built in double wardrobe and telephone point.

Shower Room (10' x 6'2 (3.05m x 1.88m))

Opaque high level double glazed window to rear, large linen cupboard and wood effect vinyl flooring. Large fully tiled shower cubicle with wall mounted thermostatic controls, low level WC, wash hand basin mounted on vanity unit with mixer tap, local tiling and wall mounted mirror above.

Lounge (16'3 x 13'2 (4.95m x 4.01m))

Double glazed panoramic picture window to rear, coving and radiator. Television, telephone and cable TV points.

Fitted Kitchen (16'10 x 6'3 (5.13m x 1.91m))

Double glazed window to front, coving and radiator. Range of wall and base units with work surfaces over, stainless steel sink with mixer tap and drainer, Bosch washing machine, under counter fridge, fridge freezer and free standing gas cooker. Telephone point, breakfast bar and vinyl flooring.

Bedroom One (13'3 x 9'5 (4.04m x 2.87m))

Double glazed window to front, coving, radiator and wood laminate flooring.

Integral Garage & Driveway

Up and over door to front. Wall mounted combination boiler, power and light.

Communal Grounds

Well maintained secure communal grounds with central lake, mature shrub beds, laid lawn and seating areas.

Lease & Charges

We have been informed that the property will be sold with an extended lease, however there are 49 years remaining on the lease at present, with the extended lease being 139 years. The current charges are approximately £600.00 per quarter. It can be paid by monthly direct debit if preferred.

Directions

From our office at the top of Westmoreland Road head towards Bromley Town Centre. Turn right into Pickhurst Park and follow the road into Barnhill Avenue, which in turn will lead into Fair Acres. Follow the road to the left and the entrance to Britten Lodge can be found on the corner.

listing.description: Situated in an over60s retirement development, the lounge is bright and spacious with pleasant views over the gardens and Bromley Road and the master bedroom has an ensuite shower room. The property is well-presented and carpeted throughout with a separate kitchen and entrance hallway.Challoner Court is a well maintained development, under the supervision of a resident house manager and her team, and is ideally located on the Bromley Road. It is close to Shortlands Overground station, which provides 25-minute access to Central London. There are numerous local bus routes, parks, golf courses and amenity shops and restaurants.Challoner Court benefits from parking and south-facing landscaped communal gardens that receive sunlight throughout the day. Newspapers are delivered daily to apartments, and the pharmacy delivers medication.Accommodation:• Lounge/dining room• Kitchen with fitted cupboards• Master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, sockets and ensuite shower room with shower, hand wash basin, vanity unit and WC• Second bedroom with sockets and shelving• Guest bathroom with bath and shower, hand wash basin, vanity unit and WC• Balcony• Pull cord alarms fitted throughout• Resident house manager• Lifts x 2• Landscaped gardens• Communal drawing room, guest suite & hairdressing facilities available to residents• Guest parking available for priority use by residentsApproximate Gross Internal Area: 71.2 sq m/ 766 sq ftLeasehold length: 99 years from 29 September 1986Ground rent: £60 p.A.Local authority: London Borough of Bromley (Band D)Energy Performance Rating: C-77

listing.short_description:
Smart 'Chain Free' double bedroom second floor apartment with extended lease set within the ever popular Fair Acres development close to local shops and a short walk to Bromley South Station and the shops and amenities of central Bromley. The property overlooks the communal grounds and lake, facing West thus enjoying the evening sun. Comprising 16' lounge, fitted kitchen, double bedroom with built in wardrobes and bathroom with white suite and Triton electric shower, this apartment is ideal for both first time buyers and buy to let investors alike.

Communal Entrance

Communal entrance with stairs and lift to all floors accessed via secure entry phone system.

Range of fitted wall and base units with work surfaces over, stainless steel sink with mixer tap and drainer, space and point for gas cooker with extractor hood over, space and plumbing for washing machine and space for under counter fridge freezer.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.letting_fees:
Referencing fee payable per occupant over 18 years old.

England and Wales - £118.80 inc. VAT.

London - £150 inc. VAT.

Students - £72 inc. VAT.

Includes the full cost of referencing all of the tenants that will form part of the tenancy and will cover:

- Checking credit status;

- Previous employer;

- Current or past landlords; and

- Any other information to help assess the affordability of the application.

Company lets will be subject to an administration fee charge of £90 inc. VAT.

Inventory fee (England, Wales and London only)

Some landlords ask Purplebricks to employ an external inventory company to produce an inventory for their property before the move in. Where this applies, the cost is split between the landlord and tenant.

Inventory documentation will detail the fixtures, fittings and condition of a property prior to the commencement of a tenancy; this will subsequently provide the basis for settlement in a deposit dispute. If an inventory is inadequate or non-existent then a deposit adjudicator is likely to award the deposit to the outgoing tenant, leaving a landlord out of pocket for any dirt or damage that is left behind.

Purplebricks can arrange for an inventory to be compiled at a cost to the tenant of £90 inc. VAT for 1 to 3 bed properties and £120 inc. VAT for 4+ bed properties. Please note that London properties will be subject to a variation on these prices, £120 inc. VAT for 1-3 bedrooms and £150 inc. VAT for 4+ bedrooms.

Scotland

Prospective tenants of properties in Scotland are not required to pay any of the fees detailed above.

Northern Ireland

Prospective tenants of properties in Northern Ireland will be asked to pay £48 inc. VAT referencing fees per person. No inventory fees will be payable.

listing.letting_fees:
Please note the charges listed below are the maximum fees that will be applied depending on your circumstances and the number of tenants.


Tenancy agreement


Before any tenancy begins you will sign a Tenancy Agreement setting out the landlord's and tenant's obligations. A charge of £300 is made for the preparation of the original Agreement and a further £125 for any extension Agreement(s) subsequently entered into.

Should you change tenants at any point during the tenancy you must inform us and, subject to your landlord's agreement (which might include the need to take up new references) we will prepare new documents for signature. Our fee for this will be £300.


Security deposit


A security deposit is required equating to at least 1 and a half month's rent. This deposit is held by us or passed to your landlord.


Tenancy deposit protection


Your security deposit must be protected by your agent or the landlord via a government approved tenancy deposit scheme. This is to ensure that if disputes arise these will be resolved by an independent third party. Within 30 days of paying your deposit your landlord or agent is required to give you details of the scheme.


Initial monies


The Initial Money consists of:

  • First month's rent in advance


  • Security Deposit


  • Administration Fee £50 per tenant


  • Referencing Fee £75 per tenant


  • Check-in fee - minimum of £72.00 (There may be instances where applicants pay for check-outs instead. Contact your local branch for more information)


  • Tenancy Agreement £300 (if supplied by us)


If there are any guarantors to the tenancy:

  • Guarantor Referencing Fee £100 per guarantor


  • Agreement of Guarantee £75


And if the tenant is a company:

  • Company Referencing Fee £175


Other Charges:

  • Change of Sharer £300


  • Extension Agreements £125


  • Outgoing reference fee £24


Optional extras if agreed:

  • Saturday Move-In £60


The Initial Money will be confirmed and must be paid by debit card, bankers draft or building society cheque. If you use a credit card there will be a 3% additional fee.

We do not accept cash.

Rental payments

All rent is payable in advance by standing order. All payments should be made 72hrs prior to your rent due date to allow for clearance. Any financial problems you may encounter should reported to us.

listing.letting_fees:
Referencing fee payable per occupant over 18 years old.

England and Wales - £118.80 inc. VAT.

London - £150 inc. VAT.

Students - £72 inc. VAT.

Includes the full cost of referencing all of the tenants that will form part of the tenancy and will cover:

- Checking credit status;

- Previous employer;

- Current or past landlords; and

- Any other information to help assess the affordability of the application.

Company lets will be subject to an administration fee charge of £90 inc. VAT.

Inventory fee (England, Wales and London only)

Some landlords ask Purplebricks to employ an external inventory company to produce an inventory for their property before the move in. Where this applies, the cost is split between the landlord and tenant.

Inventory documentation will detail the fixtures, fittings and condition of a property prior to the commencement of a tenancy; this will subsequently provide the basis for settlement in a deposit dispute. If an inventory is inadequate or non-existent then a deposit adjudicator is likely to award the deposit to the outgoing tenant, leaving a landlord out of pocket for any dirt or damage that is left behind.

Purplebricks can arrange for an inventory to be compiled at a cost to the tenant of £90 inc. VAT for 1 to 3 bed properties and £120 inc. VAT for 4+ bed properties. Please note that London properties will be subject to a variation on these prices, £120 inc. VAT for 1-3 bedrooms and £150 inc. VAT for 4+ bedrooms.

Scotland

Prospective tenants of properties in Scotland are not required to pay any of the fees detailed above.

Northern Ireland

Prospective tenants of properties in Northern Ireland will be asked to pay £48 inc. VAT referencing fees per person. No inventory fees will be payable.
